title: Evaluation of Segment Anything Model 2: The Role of SAM2 in the Underwater Environment
abstract: arXiv:2408.02924v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: With breakthroughs in large-scale modeling, the Segment Anything Model (SAM) and its extensions have been attempted for applications in various underwater visualization tasks in marine sciences, and have had a significant impact on the academic community. Recently, Meta has further developed the Segment Anything Model 2 (SAM2), which significantly improves running speed and segmentation accuracy compared to its predecessor. This report aims to explore the potential of SAM2 in marine science by evaluating it on the underwater instance segmentation benchmark datasets UIIS and USIS10K. The experiments show that the performance of SAM2 is extremely dependent on the type of user-provided prompts. When using the ground truth bounding box as prompt, SAM2 performed excellently in the underwater instance segmentation domain. However, when running in automatic mode, SAM2's ability with point prompts to sense and segment underwater instances is sig

Title: Evaluation of Segment Anything Model 2: The Role of SAM2 in the Underwater Environment
Abstract: arXiv:2408.02924v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: With breakthroughs in large-scale modeling, the Segment Anything Model (SAM) and its extensions have been attempted for applications in various underwater visualization tasks in marine sciences, and have had a significant impact on the academic community. Recently, Meta has further developed the Segment Anything Model 2 (SAM2), which significantly improves running speed and segmentation accuracy compared to its predecessor. This report aims to explore the potential of SAM2 in marine science by evaluating it on the underwater instance segmentation benchmark datasets UIIS and USIS10K. The experiments show that the performance of SAM2 is extremely dependent on the type of user-provided prompts. When using the ground truth bounding box as prompt, SAM2 performed excellently in the underwater instance segmentation domain. However, when running in automatic mode, SAM2's ability with point prompts to sense and segment underwater instances is sig
tldr: 该文章阐述了Meta开发的Segment Anything Model 2 (SAM2)在海洋科学研究中的应用前景，特别是在解决水面以下的实例分割问题上。实验结果表明，当使用地面真实边界框作为提示时，SAM2在水底实例分割领域表现出色。然而，当SAM2在没有提示的情况下运行自动分割时，其感知和分割水面以下实例的能力受到了限制。
